SEARCH
Package us.ullberg.startpunkt.service

Class MultiClusterService

java.lang.Object
us.ullberg.startpunkt.service.MultiClusterService
@ApplicationScoped public class MultiClusterService extends Object
Service for managing cluster configurations.

This service manages local Kubernetes client and remote GraphQL cluster configurations.

      localClient - the local Kubernetes client (injected by Quarkus)
      clustersConfig - the clusters configuration (injected by Quarkus)

  • Method Details

    • getClient

      public io.fabric8.kubernetes.client.KubernetesClient getClient(String clusterName)
      Get the Kubernetes client for a specific cluster. Only returns a client for the local cluster.
      Parameters:
      clusterName - the cluster name
      Returns:
      the Kubernetes client for local cluster, or null if not configured or remote

    • getLocalClient

      public io.fabric8.kubernetes.client.KubernetesClient getLocalClient()
      Get the local Kubernetes client.
      Returns:
      the local client, or null if disabled

    • getActiveClusterNames

      public List<String> getActiveClusterNames()
      Get all active cluster names (local + remote GraphQL clusters).
      Returns:
      list of cluster names

    • getActiveClusterCount

      public int getActiveClusterCount()
      Get the number of active clusters.
      Returns:
      count of active clusters

    • isClusterActive

      public boolean isClusterActive(String clusterName)
      Check if a cluster is configured and active.
      Parameters:
      clusterName - the cluster name
      Returns:
      true if the cluster is active

    • getClusterConfig

      public Optional<ClusterConfig> getClusterConfig(String clusterName)
      Get configuration for a specific cluster.
      Parameters:
      clusterName - the cluster name
      Returns:
      the cluster configuration, or empty if not found

    • getAllClusterConfigs

      public Map<String,ClusterConfig> getAllClusterConfigs()
      Get all active cluster configurations.
      Returns:
      map of cluster name to configuration

    • getLocalClusterDisplayName

      public String getLocalClusterDisplayName()
      Get the display name for the local cluster.
      Returns:
      the local cluster display name, or "local" if not configured
